abstract: The year started off exceptionally slow for mergers and acquisitions in the United States. There was only $34.2 billion worth of announced deals in January, according to Standard & Poor’s Capital IQ, making it the slowest first month of the year since 2003.

lead_paragraph: The year started off exceptionally slowly for mergers and acquisitions in the United States. There was only $34.2 billion worth of announced deals in January, according to Standard & Poor’s Capital IQ, making it the slowest first month of the year since 2003.

headline.main: Big Chill Hit the Deal Market in January
